overview:
Kiernan has over 15 years experience spanning the education and digital media space in executive roles with Kaplan Educational Centers, GreatSchools.net and Common Sense Media.

While working for The Washington Post Company, he helped launch the Kaplan-Simon & Schuster publishing business and served as the Managing Editor for the Newsweek-Kaplan imprint, driving the launch of the first international edition of â€œHow to Get Into College.â€ He later led Kaplanâ€™s launch of the first nationwide in-home tutoring company, spearheading its growth from 4 to 26 major US markets.

Moving into the digital world, Kiernan would go on to lead business development and product at GreatSchools.net, an online consumer guide to K-12 school data. Most recently, he served as Chief Development Officer at Common Sense Media, which helps parents make informed decisions about their kids use of media and technology. During his tenure there, he built the organizationâ€™s first online product team and managed all revenue operations. He oversaw the development and implementation of a digital distribution network reaching tens of millions of end users with companies that include Comcast, DIRECTV, Time Warner Cable, Verizon, AOL, Yahoo!, Netflix and others.

Kiernan holds a BA from the College of the Holy Cross and an MA in history from Boston University.
